name: funster
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who likes to joke and have fun rather than being serious: He is a comedian, a trickster, a funster. The press portrayed her as a party-loving funster.
More examplesFewer examplesHis clothes seem to say "I may have a boring office job but I'm a wacky funster by night."As he could not compete with his brother, he dedicated himself to being the funster, the genial joker.During the cruise, some funster discovered the controls to the PA system and blared out a call to abandon ship. You do not think of the average research scientist as being a zany funster.
